introduction: Publisher Correction: In emergencies, health research must go beyond public engagement toward a true partnership with those affected

John Nkengasong: Correction to: Nature Medicine https://doi.org/10.1038/s41591-020-0771-1, published online 27 January 2020. In the version of this article initially published, the date (year) was incorrect (10 January 2010) in the penultimate sentence of the first paragraph of the third subsection (‘Why Africa should be prepared’). The correct date is 10 January 2020. The error has been corrected in the HTML and PDF versions of the article.
Publisher Correction: In emergencies, health research must go beyond public engagement toward a true partnership with those affected
Katharine Wright, Michael Parker and the Nuffield Council on Bioethics Working Group

Correction to: Nature Medicine https://doi.org/10.1038/s41591-020-0758-y, published online 28 January 2020. In the version of this article initially published, the affiliation lists were incorrect. The correct lists and their linkages are as follows: Katharine Wright1, Michael Parker2 and the Nuffield Council on Bioethics Working Group3 1Nuffield Council on Bioethics, London, UK. 2Wellcome Centre for Ethics and Humanities and the Ethox Centre, University of Oxford, Oxford, UK. 3A list of members and affiliations appears at the end of the paper. Nuffield Council on Bioethics Working Group Sanjoy Bhattacharya4, Karl Blanchet5, Simon Caney6, Emily Ying Yang Chan7, Beatriz da Costa Thomé8, Philippe Guérin9, Julian Hughes10, Patricia Kingori11, Heidi Larson12, Soka Moses13, Sharifah Sekalala14, Julian Sheather15 and Paulina Tindana16 4WHO Collaborating Centre for Global Health Histories, University of York, York, UK. 5Faculty of Medicine, University of Geneva and Director of the Centre for Education and Research in Humanitarian Action (CERAH), Geneva, Switzerland. 6University of Warwick, Coventry, UK. 7Faculty of Medicine, Chinese University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong. 8Preventive Medicine Department, Federal University of São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil. 9Centre for Tropical Medicine and Global Health, University of Oxford, Oxford, UK. 10University of Bristol, Bristol, UK. 11Nuffield Department of Population Health, University of Oxford, Oxford, UK. 12London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, London, UK. 13Ministry of Health, Monrovia, Liberia. 14School of Law, University of Warwick, Coventry, UK. 15British Medical Association, London, UK. 16Department of Health Policy, Planning and Management, University of Ghana, Accra, Ghana. The errors have been corrected in the HTML and PDF versions of the article.
